com.snap2d.light

Class Light

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.snap2d.light.Light
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DirectionalLight, RadialLight

    public abstract class Light
extends Object
    Abstract implementation of 2D light. Light uses double values to store distance and location data but can be initialized using world or screen space coordinates. However, the distance and location, as well as any values passed into Light for calculations, should refer to the same coordinate space in which Light was created.
    Author:
    Brian Groenke

      • computeLuminosity

        public double computeLuminosity(int x,
                       int y)
        Computes luminosity as a fraction that can be multiplied against 255 to get the resulting shadow alpha value (0.0 = total light/no shadow - 1.0 = total darkness). The luminosity fraction should be independent of world/screen space differences. The default implementation uses magnitudes to calculate luminosity, so the calculated light values will map a radial pattern.
        Parameters:
        x - the x location to measure brightness for (should be in same coordinate space as light)
        y - the y location to measure brightness for (should be in same coordinate space as light)
        Returns:
        the luminosity fraction measuring shadow alpha

      • contains

        public abstract boolean contains(int x,
               int y)
